吳.definition: surname Wu; area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai; name of states in southern China at different historical periods

吳三桂.definition: Wu Sangui (1612-1678), Chinese general who let the Manchus into China and helped them establish the Qing Dynasty, later leading a revolt against Qing in an effort to start his own dynasty

吳下阿蒙.definition: General Lü Meng 呂蒙|吕蒙 of the southern state of Wu (idiom); model of self-improvement by diligent study (from unlettered soldier to top strategist of Wu)

吳中.definition: Wuzhong district of Suzhou city 蘇州市|苏州市[Su1 zhou1 shi4], Jiangsu

吳中區.definition: Wuzhong district of Suzhou city 蘇州市|苏州市[Su1 zhou1 shi4], Jiangsu

吳仁寶.definition: Wu Renbao (1928-2013), former CCP chief of Huaxi Village 華西村|华西村[Hua2 xi1 Cun1], responsible for turning it into a modern rich community

吳任臣.definition: Wu Renchen (1628-1689), Qing dynasty polymath and historian, author of History of Ten States of South China 十國春秋|十国春秋

吳作棟.definition: Goh Chok Tong (1941-), Singapore businessman and politician, prime minister 1990-2004

吳儀.definition: Wu Yi (1938-), one of four vice-premiers of the PRC State Council

吳儂嬌語.definition: pleasant-sounding Wu dialect; also written 吳儂軟語|吴侬软语[Wu2 nong2 ruan3 yu3]

吳哥窟.definition: Angkor Wat, temple complex in Cambodia

吳嘉經.definition: Wu Jiajing (1618-1684), early Qing dynasty poet

吳國.definition: Wu state (in south China, in different historical periods); Wu state 220-280, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权 the southernmost of the three Kingdoms

吳堡.definition: Wubu County in Yulin 榆林[Yu2 lin2], Shaanxi

吳堡縣.definition: Wubu County in Yulin 榆林[Yu2 lin2], Shaanxi

吳子.definition: Wuzi, one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1], written by Wu Qi 吳起|吴起[Wu2 Qi3]

吳孟超.definition: Wu Mengchao (1922-), Chinese medical scientist and surgeon specializing in liver and gallbladder disorders

吳官正.definition: Wu Guanzheng (1938-), former CCP Secretary of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection

吳尊.definition: Wu Zun or Chun Wu (1979-), Bruneian actor, vocalist of Fei Lun Hai (Fahrenheit)

吳川.definition: Wuchuan, county-level city in Zhanjiang 湛江[Zhan4 jiang1], Guangdong

吳川市.definition: Wuchuan, county-level city in Zhanjiang 湛江[Zhan4 jiang1], Guangdong

吳市吹簫.definition: to beg while playing the xiao 簫|箫[xiao1] (mouth organ); cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥[Wu3 Zi3 xu1], destitute refugee from Chu 楚[Chu3], busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician

吳廣.definition: Wu Guang (died 208 BC), Qin dynasty rebel, leader of the Chen Sheng Wu Guang Uprising 陳勝吳廣起義|陈胜吴广起义[Chen2 Sheng4 Wu2 Guang3 Qi3 yi4]

吳建豪.definition: Wu Jianhao or Vanness Wu (1978-), Taiwan pop star and actor, F4 band member

吳忠.definition: see 吳忠市|吴忠市[Wu2zhong1 Shi4]

吳忠市.definition: Wuzhong, prefecture-level city in Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region 寧夏回族自治區|宁夏回族自治区[Ning2xia4 Hui2zu2 Zi4zhi4qu1]

吳承恩.definition: Wu Cheng'en (1500-1582), author (or compiler) of novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记

吳敬梓.definition: Wu Jingzi (1701-1754), Qing dynasty novelist, author of The Scholars 儒林外史[Ru2lin2 Wai4shi3]

吳旗.definition: Wuqi town and county, Shaanxi; old spelling of Wuqi 吳起|吴起[Wu2 qi3]

吳旗縣.definition: Wuqi county, Shaanxi; old spelling of 吳起縣|吴起县[Wu2 qi3 xian4]

吳晗.definition: Wu Han (1909-1969), historian, author of biography of Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋, hounded to his death together with several members of his family during the cultural revolution

吳楚.definition: southern states of Wu and Chu; the middle and lower Yangtze valley

吳橋.definition: Wuqiao county in Cangzhou 滄州|沧州[Cang1 zhou1], Hebei

吳橋縣.definition: Wuqiao county in Cangzhou 滄州|沧州[Cang1 zhou1], Hebei

吳淞.definition: Wusong river and dock area in Shanghai

吳牛見月.definition: cow from Wu is terrified by the moon, mistaking it for the sun

吳玉章.definition: Wu Yuzhang (1878-1966), writer, educator and communist politician

吳王闔廬.definition: King Helu of Wu (-496 BC, reigned 514-496 BC); also called 吳王闔閭|吴王阖闾

吳王闔閭.definition: King Helu of Wu (-496 BC, reigned 514-496 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸; also called 吳王闔廬|吴王阖庐

吳用.definition: Wu Yong, character of 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4], nicknamed Resourceful Star 智多星[Zhi4 duo1 xing1]

吳自牧.definition: Wu Zimu (lived c. 1270), writer at the end of the Song dynasty

吳興.definition: Wuxing district of Huzhou city 湖州市[Hu2 zhou1 shi4], Zhejiang

吳興區.definition: Wuxing district of Huzhou city 湖州市[Hu2 zhou1 shi4], Zhejiang

吳語.definition: Wu dialects (spoken primarily in Shanghai and surrounding areas)

吳起.definition: Wuqi county in Yan'an 延安[Yan2 an1], Shaanxi

吳起縣.definition: Wuqi county in Yan'an 延安[Yan2 an1], Shaanxi

吳越.definition: states of south China in different historical periods; proverbially perpetual arch-enemies

吳越同舟.definition: Wu and Yue in the same boat (idiom); fig. cooperation between natural rivals; to collaborate towards a common end; in the same boat together

吳越春秋.definition: History of the Southern States Wu and Yue (traditional rivals), compiled by Han historian Zhao Ye 趙曄|赵晔[Zhao4 Ye4], 10 extant scrolls

吳趼人.definition: Wu Jianren (1867-1910), late Qing dynasty novelist, author of The strange state of the world witnessed over 20 years 二十年目睹之怪現狀|二十年目睹之怪现状

吳邦國.definition: Wu Bangguo (1941-), PRC electrical engineer and politician, politburo member 1992-2012

吳鎮宇.definition: Francis Ng Chun-Yu (1961-), Hong Kong actor

吳頭楚尾.definition: lit. head in Wu and tail in Chu (idiom); fig. close together; head-to-tail; one thing starts where the other leaves off
